channel.title: Data-Pipelines on Systology
channel.description: Recent content in Data-Pipelines on Systology

item.title: Beam Trial
item.description: Minimal Apache Beam Hello World in Java/Gradle demonstrating pipeline construction, transforms, and DirectRunner execution for learning Beam’s core model.

item.title: Data Pipelines
item.description: Principles for reliable batch and streaming pipelines: time semantics, fault tolerance, partitioning, observability, and reproducibility.

item.title: Distributed Web Crawler
item.description: Design for a Google-scale web crawler focusing on Breadth-First Search (BFS), DNS resolution caching, robots.txt politeness, and handling duplicate or malicious domains.

item.title: ETL Pipeline for ML Features
item.description: Robust ETL pipeline for deterministic, reproducible ML feature generation from diverse sources, with idempotence and scale in mind.

item.title: Flink Trial
item.description: Streaming analytics demo for simulated IoT events â€” emphasizes time semantics, state backends, checkpointing, and fault tolerance.

item.title: Intervals & Constraints
item.description: Balancing Latency (Completeness) against Verification (Integrity) by choosing between Speculative and Pessimistic intervals.

item.title: Mailprune
item.description: Local-first email auditing and cleanup tool that identifies noisy senders and produces privacy-preserving recommendations.

item.title: Real-Time Analytics Pipeline
item.description: Scalable real-time pipeline to ingest and process high-volume user event streams for immediate analytics and dashboards; handles late arrivals and fault tolerance.

item.title: Spark Trial
item.description: End-to-end ETL example using Apache Spark for parquet datasets; focuses on schema handling, partitioning, and reproducible aggregation.
